DOC.detailed_description: A genomics-based approach target identify candidate gene search variant may explain response observed biomarkers symptoms deficient individual replete . The long-term objective study translate finding next-generation sequencing ( NGS ) technology clinically meaningful data regard vitamin D supplementation Service Members ( SM ) may risk musculoskeletal disorder immune dysfunction impact physical performance military readiness . We propose follow specific aim : 1 ) explore phenotypic expression vitamin D status cohort SM determine common symptom associate deficiency/insufficiency state ; 2 ) examine effect vitamin D level broad gene expression carefully choose candidate gene know influence vitamin D status , bone density , immune function ; 3 ) evaluate change gene expression level within group supplement low vs high vitamin D , compare healthy control , 4 ) examine relationship vitamin D deficiency clinically relevant outcome stress fracture high blood pressure supplementation therapeutic plasma level 25 ( OH ) D. This prospective , randomize , double-blind trial enroll 105 SM Northwest evaluate frequency , symptom , genomic expression vitamin D level use survey instrument , immunologic bone biomarkers , NGS white blood cell pre- post-supplementation oral vitamin D 3 month . Participant follow-up 12 month evaluate maintenance adequate circulating vitamin D ; timeframe represent typical deployment period .
DOC.criteria: active duty service member , age 18 year old , ability read understand English , deploy next 15 month , subjectively good health . family member , beneficiary , civilian , pregnant currently breastfeed female , anyone chronic health problem ( e.g . eat disorder , kidney disease , liver disease , intestinal malabsorption ) , active duty SM take > 400 IU/day vitamin D supplementation unwilling discontinue , current heal stress fracture , take medication endocrine disorder , synthroid , identify high potential interaction vitamin D include antiseizure medication , cyclosporine , indinavir ( Crixivan ) .
DOC.keyword: vitamin D deficiency , genomics , vitamin D supplementation
